social_posts.post_text: Congratulations to HP’s Digital Equity Team for being named a finalist for the TIME Team of the Year! We are proud to work together with @HP to accelerate digital equity for 150 million people by 2030. @Smartsheets #digitalequity #CSR  https://bit.ly/3MHG8A0

Girl Rising educators embody the spirit of lifelong learning! These teachers and facilitators regularly participate in refresher training on gender issues and best practices. This ensures they not only stay current but also exchange ideas on how to help students navigate complex concepts related to social justice, gender equity, and self-advocacy.

Recently, teachers in Khairpur, Pakistan, took part in a refresher course with Girl Rising staff, sharing ideas about how their students manage intersectional bias. It was eye-opening for many educators to realize how those with privilege in one aspect can face marginalization in other areas. These discussions play a crucial role in providing teachers and facilitators with new perspectives to bring back to their classrooms.

Explore more about our programs across eight countries worldwide by visiting the link in our bio.

📣 Shout out to Dayana Blanco, Future Rising Fellow, Bolivia for winning the United Nations Development Programme's Equator Prize! 📣

Dayana and her team of 15 Indigenous Bolivian women were honored for their innovative efforts in restoring Uru Uru Lake using nature-based solutions. The team devised a process of placing a native decontaminant plant, Totora, onto floating rafts made of recycled material and spread them out along the contaminated channels. These floating Totora plants act as natural purifiers, absorbing contaminant elements and cleansing the water that flows into the lake.

Back in 2021, the Center for Ecology and Indigenous Peoples (CEPA) raised alarms about Uru Uru lake, describing it as more plastic than water due to years of human pollution and the impact of climate change. Dayana and her team's initiative to clean the lake will bring positive changes to the hundreds of people living nearby. This impactful project signifies a positive trajectory for Bolivia in its dedicated efforts to combat climate change.

To learn more about Dayana (@blancoquirogadayana) and her project click on the link in our bio.

Every Child, Every Right. Girl Rising’s mission is rooted in children’s right to education - a right inseparable from the rights to protection, shelter, nutrition, and the simple joy of play. In the face of conflict affecting millions of children in Israel, Gaza, Sudan, Yemen, Ukraine, Mali, Ethiopia, Democratic Republic of Congo, and beyond, let’s deepen our resolve to safeguard all children’s rights.

Learn more about how you can advocate for children’s rights via the link in our bio! #worldchildrensday #worldchildren #HumanRights #protectourchildren

🌊 Beyond the Surf: Nurturing Resilience and Aspirations Through Play 🏄‍♀️👧🏽☀️🌈 Join Cata Chacon, Senior Manager of Girl Rising’s Future Rising program, as she reflects on the power of play.

Inspired by her mother and grandmother’s sacrifices, Cata co-founded the Sirenita Surf Club (@sirenitassurfclub) as a safe place for girls to play, learn, fall, and triumph on the beautiful Latin American coast. In a region where girls often have to take on adult burdens at a young age, Cata is using play not only to build resilience, creativity, and collaboration but also to simply have fun. As we celebrate #WorldChildrensDay, we invite you to learn about Cata's personal connection with play and its impact on building a brighter world.

#EveryChildEveryRight #RighttoPlay #surf

Today, on Transgender Day of Remembrance, we come together to reflect on the lives lost and the barriers faced by Transgender individuals across the world. We remember those who have tragically left us too soon due to senseless acts of violence and discrimination.

Today, we stand in solidarity with the Trans and Non-binary individuals with respect, love and empathy.  We reaffirm our commitment to advocating for a more inclusive, compassionate world. Join us in the pursuit of creating more pathways for Trans and Non-binary youth to safely access their right to education, pursue their dreams and live to their full potential.

Click on the link in our bio to learn about how you can join the movement to advocate for education equity for all.

In a world where poverty, conflict, climate change and other crises, are affecting so many, girls emerge as the superheroes we all need! 🦸✨

Educated girls hold the power to solve our planet’s most pressing issues. As girls’ education rates increase, child marriage rates decline, infant and maternal mortality rates fall and national income growth rates increase, and our ability to address the impacts of climate change increases (UNICEF).

Learn how you can invest in girls’ education, one of our world’s most powerful forces for positive change, by visiting the link in our bio.

Ever found yourself daydreaming about the adventures of a wildlife biologist? We have! And we are thriled that Future Rising Fellow Collins Busuru (@busurucollins) shared a day in his life as a wildlife biologist and environmental educator in Kenya where he regularly connects with elephants and giraffes - as well as young people who are interested in this career path.

Collins engages with his community to provide education and resources about wildlife conservation and environmental protection in the face of deforestation, overgrazing, and drought, to foster climate resilience. In Amboseli National Park he and his team also run a mentorship program for local Maasai girls, empowering young women to pursue their education and protect the Earth.

Learn more Collins’ work and Future Rising project in the link in our bio.

🛑 Stop scrolling! Urgent action is needed to eliminate gender-based violence (GBV).

One in three women have experienced physical or sexual violence at least once in their lives, according to UN Women. We cannot remain silent about the need for more protections for girls and women.

It's not enough to just be aware; we must actively work towards dismantling the systems that perpetuate violence. Support survivors, amplify their voices, and challenge the norms that enable harm.

Share this post, start conversations and be a part of the movement to end gender-based violence. Together, we can build a world where everyone lives free from fear.

NOTE: If you or someone you know is in need of GBV-related help and resources, please visit the global suport link in our bio curated by the UN Women in partnership with Meta.

When you explain quantum tunneling in a video that makes this wildly complex phenomenon understandable for just about anyone, that’s #GirlMath. Maryam Tsegaye (@maryamtsegaye) was the first Canadian to win the prestigious @Breakthrough Junior Science Challenge in 2020. Today she is studying Symbolic Systems, Music, and Science Communication at @Stanford University - and this year, she was onstage at the Breakthrough Prize ceremony in Los Angeles to receive her award alongside fellow winners Noor Haideri (2022) and Amber Kwok (2021), introduced by film star Gal Gadot and co-founder Julia Milner.

At Girl Rising, we proudly celebrate the brilliance of girls and women who redefine the world of #mathematics, proving that every equation solved is a step toward a more equal and empowered future. #GirlMath 💡📐

Investing in girls' education is the key to a brighter future for us all!🔑✨

As girls' education rates increase, child marriage rates decline, infant and maternal mortality rates fall and national growth rates increase, according to UNICEF.

This #GivingTuesday, make a gift that changes lives, communities and nations. Give today and your donation will be instantly doubled through a generous matching gift, shaping the futures of 10+ million girls in 2024, inside and outside the classroom – one girl at a time. Click on the link in bio to give today or visit:girlrising.org/donate

As world leaders travel to Dubai for the world's most important climate negotiations, COP28, they will be met by thousands of young people who are demanding urgent climate action for a sustainable future for all. Those young people include Future Rising Fellows and Girl Rising Student Ambassadors. In an article published today, Girl Rising President Nidhi Shukla (@nidhi2601) highlights the stories of the young people shaping the future through climate action and education. Nidhi calls attention to the transformative power of education in addressing the climate crisis.  Read how remarkable young women like Zainab Bie (@zainab_bie), Sushmita Krishnan (@sushmita.krishnan), Licypriya Kangujam (@licypriyakangujam) and Hina Saifi (@hinasaifi_1050) are leading the way.

#GirlsEducation #ClimateAction #GirlRising #COP28 #FutureRising #StudentAmbassadors

Click on the link in our bio to read Nidhi’s full insight on India’s role in tackling climate change.

Today marks the start of COP28, the most influential climate conference globally! Running through December 12th, it holds the power to shape climate actions for the next year and beyond This is a critical time for individuals, nonprofits and the private sector to unite in calling for meaningful climate action and advocating for inclusive decision-making that recognizes the role of education in a more sustainable future.

Here’s how you can join the movement:

✍️Write to your government leaders and hold them accountable for more climate resilient plans
📱Call your local officials and tell them to prioritize climate and gender justice
🌎Share awareness about COP28 and the related issues on social media

Visit the link in our bio to download letter and phone scripts to reach out to government organizations, and a social media toolkit with designed posts and suggested captions. Follow along for the next couple of weeks to see important climate advocacy and information from #COP28.

#climatejustice #climateaction #genderequity #climateeducation

📌Future Rising Fellows from across the globe stand united in a powerful call for action at #COP28 and beyond 📌

In an open letter they urge global leaders to prioritize climate education, hold wealthy nations accountable for their impact, and ensure gender justice is at the core of climate action plans.

If we act collectively now, we can make a difference in our current world and the future. It’s critical that demand that world leaders take meaningful steps now to address #climatejustice and hold global warming to safe levels. Join the #FutureRising Fellows in their call to action. Click on the link in our bio to read the Fellows' full letter and share to spread the message.

#climateaction #genderequity #climateeducation

🚨 Urgent: The climate crisis needs immediate action 🚨

The climate crisis reached unprecedented levels this year, with record-breaking wildfires, catastrophic floods, and record-breaking heat waves. The time for action is running out. We must act now to put our creativity, innovation and resolve to work - and invest in girls' education as one of the world's most potent solutions.

Join us in reaching out to government leaders calling immediate climate action. Visit the link in our bio to download letter and phone scripts and a social media toolkit to support your advocacy.

#climatejustice #climateactionnow #cop28 #girlseducation

When you spend a career investigating what drives the persistent #gendergap in the labor market and how to narrow it, then win the #NobelPrize in Economics for your efforts making you the third woman and the first solo woman to win it, that’s #GirlMath. 

Through her ongoing research, Claudia Goldin provided the first comprehensive account of American women’s earnings and job market outcomes through the centuries. Her research illustrates how differences in pay and labor force participation cannot be attributed to biological differences, but to the division of unpaid caregiving and household labor between heterosexual couples.

“We are never going to have gender equality, or narrow the pay gap, until we have couple’s equity,” says Goldin.

We agree. At Girl Rising, we proudly celebrate the brilliance of girls and women who redefine the world of #mathematics, proving that every equation solved is a step toward a more equal and empowered future. #GirlMath 💡📐 #genderequity #girlsinmath

Celebrate #WorldSoilDay with a meal based on #millets!

🌾 Move over quinoa, wheat and rice - there is a new grain in town and it is stealing the spotlight with its sustainability benefits.

Sushmita Krishnan (@sushmita.krishnan), Future Rising Fellow, India, explores how Indian farmers and scientists are advancing the growth of millets to combat climate challenges such as food and water scarcity. Girls and women are often disproportionately tasked with food and water procurement and yet are the ones with the highest food and water insecurity rates, according to The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. With the growing impacts of climate change the lack of these vital resources can gravely impact girls and women in the upcoming years. Innovative solutions to explore the most sustainable foods and lifestyle choices play an important part in advancing climate justice and gender equity. 

Read more about millets and Sushmita’s research by visiting the link in our bio.

As the world unites for COP28, let’s spotlight a critical aspect of climate action: GENDER JUSTICE.

Climate change affects girls and women first and worst, with 80% of climate refugees being girls and women. Yet, they are powerful agents of change and innovation. 

Empowering women is a crucial strategy for effective climate resilience. Don’t let COP28 leaders forget it!
This week let’s fill social media feeds with messages that establish that climate justice starts with gender justice.

Click on the link in our bio to download advocacy images and suggested language to use in your posts.
✊🏽: @zoda.mirakova

There is no gender justice without climate justice! As world leaders, educators, scientists and activists come together at COP28, let’s fill their social media feed with messages spotlighting the importance of prioritizing girls and women in climate action plans. Who’s with us? ✊✨

We encourage you to also visit the link in our bio to download letter and phone scripts and a social media toolkit to amplify your climate advocacy. 
✊🏽: @andyvillarrealr

When @kamonjo_mercy Future Rising Fellow, Kenya saw the impact of food scarcity in her community where herds of cattle and goats were dying off due to drought, she was motivated to learn more about sustainable agriculture. 

Today she shares her expertise with rural and Indigenous women to teach them how to grow climate-resilient vegetables. The organization she founded, Kuza Generation, has now trained more than 500 women in techniques to feed their families through climate-smart farming approaches.

While leaders are in the midst of climate negotiations at COP28, Cyclone Michaung has hit India, leaving the coastal city of Chennai submerged. Future Rising Fellow Sushmita Krishnan, India, knows just what is at stake for her country where the dense populations of coastal cities like Chennai, Mumbai, Kolkata face increasing risk to life and livelihood. 

In her article for Girl Rising, Sushmita makes a powerful demand for comprehensive solutions for resilient infrastructure and sustainable urban planning. The time for action is now. Join Sushmita and Girl Rising in advocating for change.

Human rights for all are non-negotiable! On this Human Rights Day, we direct the world's attention to the ongoing conflicts in Ethiopia, Ukraine, Israel-Palestine, Sudan, Yemen, and many others in the world. In the midst of these conflicts, human rights are being violated, and countless people are suffering.

Since the establishment of the first Human Rights Day in 1950 by the United Nations, progress has been made in global human rights laws, but huge challenges remain in creating a world free from violence, fear, and injustice. In areas of conflict and war, we recognize the critical need for immediate attention to address human rights violations and alleviate the unimaginable hardships faced by countless individuals.

Join us in amplifying the call for global attention to these human rights crises. At Girl Rising we focus on investing in children and their right to education - a right that changes lives and unleashes ripple effects of positive change for all. Learn more about joining the movement through the link in our bio.

“Men can play a vital role in breaking down harmful stereotypes and challenging social norms that perpetuate gender inequality. Men can use their privilege and influence to amplify the voices of girls and women.” – Sarwech Mujahid, Pakistan 

From a young age in Pakistan, Sarwech understood that championing girls' rights could contribute to a better world for all. Now as an adult, he has joined forces with Girl Rising through the Kaavish Project. As a teacher in the program, he works in marginalized communities where girls face multiple barriers to their education. Girl Rising’s Kaavish Project helps adolescents build voice and agency. Our program provides educators, parents and community members with resources, training and skills to advocate for equitable, quality education. 

Sarwech’s example is helping mobilize men and boys to be part of the movement for girls' right to education in Pakistan. 

Be a part of the change! Donate today to support programs like the Kaavish Project – and your gift today will be doubled! And forward this post to a dad, uncle, grandfather, friend, or brother in your life to join our movement to invest in girls’ education!

Congratulations to Hilda Flavia Nakabuye, Future Rising Fellow, Uganda, for being the recipient of the @cncdh.france Human Rights Prize! 

Hilda was honored by the French government for her tireless commitment to climate advocacy and for championing girls' education as a climate solution. Hilda and her peers at Fridays for Future, Uganda (@fridays4futureug) have endured threats, arrests and other barriers in order to bring attention to environmental solutions that will protect the rights of  individuals globally.
 
Hilda's personal story shows the powerful impact of educating girls. She uses her knowledge, skills and voice to help her community and fight for justice. Girl Rising salutes Hilda and her team for courageous climate action and for their commitment to human rights! Follow Hilda (@nakabuyehildaflavia) to learn more and support her advocacy.

Introducing Nicole Savini, the newest addition to Girl Rising's team as the Future
Rising Program’s Executive Producer!

Nicole is a @peabodyawards Award-winning producer with roots in political comedy and experience across television, live events, and academia. Her producing work includes late-night comedy programs such as Late Night with Conan O'Brien (@teamcoco), The Colbert Report, The Late Show with Stephen Colbert (@colbertlateshow with @stephenathome) and the animated satirical news show, @tooning.out, but, by far, she says her best productions are her two (also hilarious) children.

Nicole studied Television Production at Boston University and earned an MFA in Writing from Emerson College in Boston. She spends as much time as possible near the Atlantic Ocean, where she grew up, and loves hiking, live theater, and planning neighborhood talent show acts with her family and friends.

Join us in welcoming Nicole to the Girl Rising family! 🌟

Discovering the power of an educated girl’s voice through Girl Rising's programs in Pakistan was a game-changer for student Rida Batool. 

By exploring the stories of girls overcoming barriers, insisting on their rights, and pursuing their aspirations with her peers, Rida embraced the idea that a girl's power knows no bounds. With a new enthusiasm, she conveyed the importance of education, dreams, and equality to her sisters. But the ripple effect didn't stop there, Rida broke social norms by engaging her father in conversations about her aspirations and the aspirations of her sisters, with her father. Today, he stands by her as she dreams of overcoming financial constraints and gender stereotypes to become a dentist. 

👏 Let's celebrate Rida and all the girls like her who are rewriting their futures, one story at a time. Leave some words of encouragement for Rida in the comments below!

Tia Kennedy (@tiakennedy23), a Future Rising Fellow and First Nations climate justice activist, from Canada's Anishinaabe tribe, is driving change through filmmaking to address water contamination issues in her community caused by heavy industry. Tia's Future Rising film project focused on the fight for environmental justice in her region was just chosen for funding consideration by The Redford Center.

Tia's voice is reaching new global audiences. This fall, as part of Girl Rising's Future Rising Fellowship, she spoke at a UN General Assembly event, highlighting how educating girls is one of the world's most potent climate solutions. Tia’s own personal story, of using her education to advocate for her community and fight for justice, is a powerful testament to the far-reaching impact of educating girls.

At Girl Rising, we are proud to support her work and leadership. Support Future Rising Fellows like Tia—double your impact by donating today, click the link in our bio and donate! 🌎✨

Congratulations to Shakhzoda Mirakova (@zoda.mirakova ), Future Rising Fellow, Uzbekistan who was selected as one of only 25 members to join the European Union’s (EU) Youth Sounding Board, a group of young people who advise the Commissioner and the Directorate-General for International Partnerships (DG INTPA) on youth participation and empowerment in EU external action.

Shakhzoda is the first and only representative from the Central Asian region taking part in this program and was chosen from a pool of 400 candidates. As a part of her role, she attended the plenary meetings of the Youth Sounding Board in Brussels, Belgium earlier this month and addressed urgent environmental and gender issues impacting Uzbekistan and Central Asia.

“Civic engagement is not an option, it is a necessity for Central Asian communities and the whole world,” She says. “We all have to use our voices and experiences to reclaim the narrative and be the change that we wish to see.” #FutureRising #GenderJustice #ClimateJustice

Meet Nancy Afrifa, a 14-year-old from Ghana, embodying determination and resilience!

When her father’s injury and resulting disability threatened her dreams of education, Nancy didn’t back down. She joined her mother in selling goods on weekends to help fund her schooling.

Nancy is part of our Financial Education Initiative program in Ghana, where she’s gaining vital financial literacy skills. Her goal? To save up for her dream of becoming a doctor, and through her medical career bring greater equity and prosperity to her community. At Girl Rising, we know she can achieve her goal and make a transformative impact on her entire community. Go Nancy! 💪🏽

Congratulations to Debbie Odenyi (@deborahodenyi ), Girl Rising’s Kenya Program Manager, for being honored with a ReimaginED award from our partner, @metiscollective ! 👏✨

The ReimaginED awards acknowledge the efforts of highly collaborative leaders, who have played an important role in advancing education rights in Kenya. Debbie oversees the implementation of the Girl Rising Global Education Fund in Kenya which supports local leaders who have innovative, culturally-relevant ideas to advance gender equity and education quality. 

Debbie's efforts have helped transform the educational landscape in communities around Nairobi and inspired others to champion opportunities for all. Join us in celebrating Debbie's well-deserved accolade!

🌾✨Nourishing bodies, minds and dreams! Meet Future Rising Fellows Aida Namukose (@aidahaze ) and Mercy Kamonjo (@kamonjo_mercy ), who are on a mission to end food insecurity in Kenya and Uganda. Follow along as they take us behind the scenes of their work with communities living in arid regions in Kenya. 

Over 2 million people in Kenya are highly food insecure due to failed rains, low agricultural production, and high food prices, according to the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC). In Uganda, around 24% of individuals in the communities analyzed by IPC were food insecure. Women and children are worst impacted with over 650,000 of those food insecure, in Kenya for example, being children under five and 96,000 being pregnant or lactating women. Tackling key barriers to children’s education such as climate change and food insecurity is imperative to the wellbeing of the world. 

Learn more about Mercy and Aida’s work and how you can support the effort to remove barriers in the way of children’s education by visiting the link in our bio.

A story can ignite the courage and motivation needed to create a life-changing impact. Fourteen-year-old Aradhya from India discovered new strengths during Girl Rising’s storytelling sessions last year, immersing herself in powerful narratives of trailblazing girls and women like Nobel Laureate Malala Yousufzai (@malala ) and poet Amanda Gorman (@amandascgorman)

Growing up, she often witnessed girls in her village in Uttar Pradesh being taken out of school, forced into marriages, and later experiencing abuse in those marriages for dowry – a payment made by the bride’s family. Inspired by the stories of changemakers she learned of in Girl Rising’s storytelling sessions, Aradhya is determined to be a catalyst for change in her community. She aims to challenge oppressive practices holding girls and women back, advocating for increased access to education.

Aradhya knows that one is never too young to change the world. We couldn’t agree more, Aradhya!

MLK as he is fondly called, made immeasurable contributions to civil rights and the fight for equality that are still impacting ideas surrounding educational and gender equity.

Imagine a world where every climate decision-making room is filled with the brilliance and determination of girls and women. Now, let’s make it happen! 💪🌎✨

Women and girls are first and worst impacted by climate change but they also hold vital climate solutions. And yet only 33% formal roles in global climate leadership are held by women, according to the United Nations in 2021. This number is much lower in some countries.

Our future hinges on equitable climate leadership. It's time to break barriers and ensure that diverse voices shape our path to sustainability. 

Click on the link in our bio to learn more about how Future Rising Fellows in our programs are fighting for gender and climate justice.

Across the world, young people are the leading voices in the fight for climate justice. And this year, youth-led groups the @PISFCC and @WY4CJ are taking climate justice to the World’s highest court, The International Court of Justice. The court will soon give an advisory opinion on the intersection of climate change and human rights.This historic process could prove crucial in the fight to hold big polluters accountable!

Click on the link in our bio to join us and our friends at Not Just Celsius (@not.just.celsius) in signing this @eko.movement petition with a message to the European Union that nothing is more important than legally protecting our planet, vulnerable communities and future generations from the climate crisis. At Girl Rising we have seen how climate change is having a multiplier effect on barriers to girls’ education and their rights. At the same time, advancing girls’ right to a quality education and the opportunity to fully participate in the private sector, government and civil society is one of the world’s most potent solutions to the climate crisis. The ruling of the International Court of Justice is a critical step in protecting our future generations’ rights. Join the movement in the link in our bio.
